metadata.title: CVE-2020-6825 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members Tyson Smith and Christian Hollerreported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 74 and Firefox ESR 68.6.Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume thatwith enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.7.0, Firefox ESR < 68.7,and Firefox < 75.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
